summary: Northwestern University, founded in 1851 in Evanston, Illinois, is the oldest university in the state. It started as a Methodist-affiliated school but is now non-sectarian. By 1900, it was one of the largest universities in the U.S. Northwestern has 11 schools and campuses in several cities. It's known for its strong academics, research, and sports teams (Northwestern Wildcats). Many famous people, including Nobel Prize winners, have been affiliated with the university.
title: Northwestern University
